clinical_study.brief_title: Gene Expression Profiling of Breast Cancer Cells Predict the Response of Malignant Pleural Effusion
clinical_study.official_title: Gene Expression Profiling of Breast Cancer Cells in Pleural Effusion Prodict the Response of Malignant Pleural Effusion to Immunotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators want to develop a gene expression profile for the prediction of immunotherapy response of patients with metastatic breast cancer presenting malignant pleural effusion.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. The patiets with malignant pleural effusion are randomizned to be treated with cytokins(inteleukin 2) or dendritic cells(DC) plus cytokine induced killer cells(CIK) locally.
2. Malignant pleural effusion from metastatic breast cancer patient is obtained through thoracentesis and is centrifugalized to enrich cancer cells before the therapy.
3. The enriched cancer cells are flash frozen and stored at -80℃ until processing.
4. The gene expression in pleural effusion is detected by microarray to screen gene markers that are differently expressed between groups .
5. Statistical analysis is performed using unsupervised hierarchical cluster.

primary_outcome.description: Response of malignant pleural effusion to immunotherapy is evaluated with WHO guidelines

secondary_outcome.description: compare the immunological status of pleural effusion before and after the therapy

arm_group.description: The patients are randomized to receive the cytokine infusion in the pleural cavity

biospec_descr.textblock: The cancer cells are taken from the malignant pleural effusion of breast cancer patiets.

study_pop.textblock: The breast cancer patiets present with pleural effusion and can receive chemotherapy.
